page.title: 01Bawdeswell and Sparham
page.content: The area is rural in nature with two villages located on the northern side of the only major road, the A1067 Norwich to Fakenham road. Bawdeswell, the larger of the two villages, is some 18 miles west of the city of Norwich and stands higher than the rest of the area, most of which is in the Wensum Valley. Bawdeswell has been enlarged recently by modern housing developments, whereas nearby Sparham still comprises established farms and residences centred around the village church. Although mainly an agricultural area, several light industries are discreetly present providing local employment. Worthy of note are large houses namely Sparham Hall and Sparham House built in the 19'th century, and Bawdeswell Hall built in the 17'th century, owner occupied for several generations.
